(block Nil ; Initial research requirement (msnSetData gSource 'researchNeeded 3)

(msnRegisterForEvents gSource gPlayerShip) ) )

Events.OnInProgress:
(switch (objGetItems gPlayerShip "* +HereticROM;") (block Nil ; Count the number of research ROMs (enum (objGetItems gPlayerShip "* +HereticROM;") theROM (block ( (romsUsed (min (msnGetData gSource 'researchNeeded) (itmGetCount theROM))) ) (if (gr romsUsed 0) (block Nil (msnIncData gSource 'researchNeeded (- romsUsed)) (objRemoveItem gPlayerShip theROM romsUsed) ) ) ) )
(if (gr (msnGetData gSource 'researchNeeded) 0) (msnSetData gSource 'state 'researchThanks) (msnSetData gSource 'state 'researchComplete) ) )
(filter (sysFindObject Nil "TF") theObj (objGetItems theObj "* +HereticROM;")) (msnSetData gSource 'state 'findResearch)
(and (herStatus 'missionMRAD) (herStatus 'missionMaryamsArchive) (herStatus 'missionHuygensExplorer) (herStatus 'missionTaikon) ) (msnSetData gSource 'state 'waitForResearch)

Language.Text: Help Kate Morgental and her Researchers

Help stations in the system to investigate Iocrym technology. Bring research data back to Kate's scientists so they can figure out a way to disable the Iocrym quarantine.
System: %systemName%\n Payment: None
Kate Morgental and her team from the Svalbard Explorer are setting up a research base here. Their goal is to understand how to break the Iocrym quarantine.

Kate Morgental approaches you:
"It looks like the Iocrym know that we're here. We've been monitoring the outer system and we've detected Iocrym activity. We think they are planning to attack us—but we don't know what their target will be. Stay sharp: we'll send a message out to you if anything happens."

You tell Kate Morgental that you have research data on the Iocrym. She and her team are happy:
"That's wonderful—we'll analyze the data and see if it can help us to break the Iocrym quarantine. Wait here while we take a look."

"Thank you! The data that your provided is very useful. We are closer to understanding how the quarantine works, but we still don't know how to disable it. If you can get us more data, that would help a lot."

"That's it! That's the missing piece! With all the data you've gathered we now understand how the Iocrym have created the quarantine. The event horizon that keeps us from leaving will collapse as soon as we disable the Iocrym manipulators deployed around the Heretic sun."
"All of the Iocrym manipulators are controlled from this position. We should be able to order the manipulators to shut down—that will break the quarantine! Stand by..."

Kate Morgental's team connects their equipment to the alien machinery. They issue commands and the alien symbols around the chamber begin to flash in unison. Suddenly, the omnipresent hum of gigantic machinery changes pitch and begins to die down.

"We've done it! The quarantine is broken! I'll get a message to St. Kat's—this is a historic moment for the human race!"
"Now you're free to continue your journey to the Core. Thanks for your help, %name%. We couldn't have done it without you. I hope to see you again someday."

Kate Morgental approaches you:
"Good to see you again! We're making progress, but we need more data. Fortunately, we've identified a wreck in the system that has the research data we need. Will you go retrieve it?"
"Thanks. We've programmed the location of the wreck into your computer. Find the wreck and bring the data it contains back to us."

Kate Morgental approaches you. She looks tired and frustrated:
"It's no use! We don't have enough data to figure out how to disable the quarantine. And the other research stations have either been destroyed or come up with nothing. Our only hope is to catch a break from some Iocrym hardware. Maybe we can salvage some data out of the wreck of an Iocrym sentinel."

Kate Morgental and her researchers are studying the alien machinery. She approaches:
"We're slowly making progress, but we need more data. Go talk to the other stations in the system and see if they have any research data that might help us."

Events.OnCreate:
(switch ; Only if the quarantine has been lifted (not (sysGetData 'G2 'quarantineLifted)) (msnDestroy gSource)
; Player must have found some more research ROMs (not (objGetItems gPlayerShip "* +HereticROM; -LesserData;")) (msnDestroy gSource)
; Set up the mission (block Nil ) )
Events.OnAccepted:
(block (romCount cubeCount) ; Count the number of research ROMs (enum (objGetItems gPlayerShip "* +HereticROM;") theROM (block Nil (setq romCount (add romCount (itmGetCount theROM))) (objRemoveItem gPlayerShip theROM) ) )
(for i 1 romCount (setq cubeCount (add cubeCount (random 2 4))) )
; Create mnemonic cubes (objAddItem gPlayerShip (itmCreate &itIocrymSentinelVirus; cubeCount))
(msnDestroy gSource) )

Language.Text:
You tell Kate's scientists that you have additional data on the Iocrym. The scientists analyze the data:
"With this research data we have been able to create an infiltration virus that can disable the Iocrym sentinels that have been attacking us. Take these mnemonic cubes and use them if your ship has a quantum CPU."
